page.title: 04Survey of Parents in Codsall
page.content: We asked the parents of Codsall Middle School children to state the buildings they considered to be most and least attractive. The Parish Church of St. Nicholas came out easily on top as the most attractive building while the South Staffordshire District Council Offices topped the poll as least attractive. (It was also some parents' most attractive building ) Some groups of shops,at Birches Bridge and in Codsall Square were also deemed unattractive. Many memories of local events were recalled,especially the street parties connected with Her Majesty's Silver Jubilee in l978 and Prince Charles' wedding in 1982. Other local memories were of the winning of "Best Kept Village" Competitions and the closure, in 1983, of Histon's Hill First School.
